NEW YORK-In answer to Sen.
Barry Goldwater's request for a
conference, Jackie Robins on re-
piled that he felt such meet
ing would be useless.


Robinso on wrote to the Republi-
can presidential nominee that he
WIS committed to work for 'way
Of life we have known and love-"


He continued saying he would
help win Republicans for Johns on
and keep defying extremism.

Robinson will Not
Meet With Barry

WASHINGTON DR.. Leonidas
H. Berry. senior attending ply
stefan of Reese Hospital, Chi
cago, was chosen president-elect
of the National Medical Associa-
ton at its Goth annual convention.


He will succeed DR.. W. Mon
tague Cobb of Washington re-
Gently elected president.


DR.. Berry is an authority on
gastroenterology and has con-
tributed several articles in lead
ing journals.


He received the fifth Warfield
award for his outstanding career.
The award Is given in honor OF
DR.. William Alonza Warfield,
who was one of the first internes
at Freedmen's Hospital in 1894.
He served as surgeon in chief
there for IS years.


DR.. Berry is the developer OF
the Berry Plan. through which
youthful narcotic users are given
counsel and treatment in clinics.

Dr.. Berry is


NAM Prexy Elect

GREENWOOD. Miss. Silas
McChee, 20, who had led activ-
ities to integrate movie theater,
was shot with a small caliber
gun. The bullet lodged behind
his nose.


Investigators said the shot
came from station wagon oc-
cupied by two white men. McChee
was sitting in parked car when
the incident occurred.

Negro Hit In


Face BY Shot

NEW YORK A civil rights
rally is planned for the precon-
vention opening of the Democratic
Party at Atlantic City, announced
Gloster Current ,NAACP director
of branches. CORE, SCLC and
SNCC will cooperate in the joint
meeting.


Bus and car cavalcades are
expected from New York, Mary
land, Pennsylvania and nearby
New Jersey cities.

Civil Rights
Groups Plan
Convention Rally

PEORIA. Ill. Billy Clemens
has filed a ST 900 damage suit
against Swan Lake Memorial
Gardens, a local cemetery.
Charges we're the manager re-
fused to sell him two plots be-
cause Negroes were not accepted.
First President to be born in a
log cabin Andrew Jacks on.

WASHINGTON, D. CA list
ing of "Colored Properties" in
the real estate section of the yell
low Pages of the Chesapeake and
Potomac Telephone Companys
directory has been dropped.
